column2: References: WSA 03-2011-3.2 Project Risk Management Plan (PRMP) MRWA Standard Drawings
1.1 - The current Water Authority Approved revision drawings are being used. including subcontractors’ copy
Acceptance Criteria - Current revision drawings are being used, ensure drawings have been Issued as IFC
1.2 - Applicable Permits obtained (includes Excavation Permits, BYD, Road Opening Permits, YVW Approvals & etc.)
Specification - Design Drawings (Refer to General Notes & Legend)
Acceptance Criteria - Permits obtained prior to demolition or construction from the relevant authorities
Acceptance Criteria - Use only products and materials specified by the Project Specification, Design Drawings or as approved by the Water Agency
1.4 - Delivery and On-Site Storage of Pipes and Fittings
Acceptance Criteria - Goods received satisfactory condition. Handled and stored in accordance with manufacturer’s recommendations.
○ Pipes are clean and free of mud/debris.
○ Pipe Ends to be capped prior to installation to avoid Debris entering Pipe
1.5 - Delivery of Pipe Bedding and embedment
Acceptance Criteria - Material to comply with WSA requirements. Material from an approved quarry From the Approved Products List
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm extent of works and ensure all services are pegged/marked.
○ Clearly labelled offset pegs indicating chainage and depth to invert.
○ Ensure survey set out is to latest revision of drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Prior to excavating trenches, remove topsoil within the width of the Formation to a depth of 150mm
2.2 - Excavate to required Width and Depth
Acceptance Criteria - 1. Keep sides of the excavation vertical to at least 150 above the pipes in strata other than sand.
2. Lay marking tape along route of the water main as per WSA03- 2012, MRWA edition.
3. Maintain minimum clearances between mains and services in accordance with Table.
4. Excessive excavation to be treated in accordance with MRWA edition of WSA 03- 2011. 5. Lay pipes in a shared trench at the same invert level where possible.
6. Maximum cover is 1.5 x minimum cover. This does not apply where main crosses under other services.

7. Cross water mains above other services (except Gas) wherever practical. When water mains pass under other services or obstructions, clearance under the obstruction or other service shall be minimised.
2.3 - Ensure pipe work is installed as per Minimum cover requirements
Acceptance Criteria - Pipes are laid to levels, grade, and alignment as per drawings Tolerances:
Specification - As per applicable Design drawings. WSA 03-2011-3.2 Section 15.2
Acceptance Criteria - Joint deflection shall not exceed the maximum permitted deflection as recommended by the manufacturer.
Acceptance Criteria - Pipe to be installed as per manufacturers. requirements.
○ Pipes to have Witness mark and correct chamfer angle.
3.4 - Installation of valves, air valves & hydrants
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure fittings are installed as per specification
Test/Inspection Frequency - Every valve and fitting
Specification - WSA 03-2011-3.2 Section 15.7 MRWA-W- 104A, 104B, 204, 205A, 205B, 205C, 206, and MRWA-W207
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure anchor blocks are constructed to WSA Standard Drawing WAT 1205 Concrete to be approved supplier
Test/Inspection Frequency - Every valve and fitting
Acceptance Criteria - All joints for polyethylene mains and fittings are to be butt welded in accordance with MRWA. 15.21.2.
○ Electrofusion welds and fittings are not permitted for use without the express written permission of YVW inspector.

○ Butt welding equipment shall be inspected, tested, tagged, and calibrated every 12 months by an approved agent, and be subject to electrical equipment inspection test in accordance with AS/NZS 3760.
○ Before commencing a welding operation, the operator shall check the machine as per manufacturer’s instructions, and the electrical cord shall not be damaged and check electrical test tag.
Conduct visual inspection of weld. Check:
– beads are same size and shape.
– beads are projected evenly around diameter of pipe.
– no cracks or obvious faults in beads
Note: Randomly selected welds from pipeline should be removed and tested during operations.
– wet entire exposed pipe surface (use anti-static liquid or dilute soap and water)
– wrap exposed pipe with wet tape conductors (or similar)
Record/evidence - Poly Weld Joint Report – WSA- ITR- W-03
Specification - WSA 03-2011-3.2 Section 16 Table 19.1 MRWA-W-200, 201, 202, & MRWA-W-203, MRWA Backfill Specification Design Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Material to be worked around pipe to ensure all voids at haunches are filled.
○ Standard compaction test as nominated on the design drawings
Test/Inspection Frequency - 1 Test at Start of Works
Specification - WSA 03-2011-3.2 Section 17 Dwgs MRWA-W- 200, 201, 202, & MRWA-W-203
Acceptance Criteria - Non-Pavement - Backfilled using select backfill material.
○ Pavement - Backfilled using 20mm Class 2 CR to underside of road preparation.
Specification - WSA 03-2011-3.2 Section 16 Table 19.1 Dwgs MRWA-W- 200, 201, 202, & MRWA-W-203, MRWA Backfill Specification Design Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Material to be compacted in layers as specified.
○ Standard compaction test as nominated on the design drawings
Test/Inspection Frequency - Tests determined by length of section and depth
Acceptance Criteria - Install detectable marking tape on top of the first compacted backfill layer of all water mains constructed using open-cut Trenching.
Acceptance Criteria - Provide location marker posts, plates, and other markings for the location of hydrants and valves as per drawings.

Acceptance Criteria - Entire pipe network to be swabbed to remove any foreign matter. Swab mains as nominated on the Design Drawings. Ensure Foam swabs are numbered and sized to be flushed through the pipe in full, and two swabs are used for each run.
Acceptance Criteria - Mains to be flushed in sections through hydrants of washouts which can develop a velocity of 0.75m/s. Mains shall then be drained and filled slowly with clean potable water.
Specification - WSA 03 2011 3.2 Section 19.4 MRWA 19.4.1.1 Design Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Test Mains to nominated pressure on design drawings.
○ Duration and allowable top up volume as per MRWA 19.4.1.1
○ Test pressures, durations and witnessing recorded on record sheet.
Acceptance Criteria - ±5 mm in road reserves, including sealed pavements.
○ +50 mm, -20 mm in non- trafficable areas
Acceptance Criteria - Mains >225mm to be disinfected in accordance with the MRWA Water Quality Compliance Specification
Acceptance Criteria - As-Built survey data, prepared, collated and submitted
Test/Inspection Frequency - At completion of each section and the job
○ Plumbing Industry Commission Certificate of Compliance issued for hydraulic installation
ITP approved for use by: Luke McFarlane
References: WSA 02 – 2014-3.1 Project Risk Management Plan (PRMP) MRWA Standard Drawings, Project Drawings – 21217s1B
1.1 - The current Water Authority Approved revision drawings are being used including subcontractors copy
Acceptance Criteria - Current revision drawings are being used, ensure drawings have been Issued as IFC
1.2 - Applicable Permits obtained (includes Excavation Permits, DBYD, Road Opening Permits & etc.)
Specification - Design Drawings (Refer to  General Notes & Legend)
Acceptance Criteria - Permits obtained prior to demolition or construction from the relevant authorities
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm extent of works and ensure all services    are pegged/marked Clearly labelled offset pegs indicating chainage and depth to invert.
○ Ensure survey set out is to latest revision of drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure   Concrete   Manhole are installed as per MRWA-S- 518 & 520 as per figure 518-F
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure Access Ladder are installed as per MRWA-S-314
Record/evidence - ITR-S-05.2, ITR-S-05.3, ITR-S-05.4, ITR-S-05.5, ITR-S-05.6, ITR-S-05.7
Acceptance Criteria - Class B concrete lid to used
Specification - WSA 02–2014-3.1 Section 20.1.4 Table 21.7 IFC MRWA Backfill Specification Design Drawings MRWA specification No. 04-03.2
Acceptance Criteria - Material to be compacted in layers as specified
○ Standard compaction test as nominated on the design drawings.
○ 20mm CL4 or CL3 crushed rock or crushed concrete backfill.
Test/Inspection Frequency - Tests determined by length of section and depth
○ Plumbing Industry Commission Certificate of Compliance issued for hydraulic installation
